WorkItem.Description: ok problem is i just started geting this error says the app failed to initialize prperly (0xc0000135) click ok to termanate the program WTF

Comments.Message:
I'm sorry, this is getting REALLY old, REALLY quickly.  Look in the readme that comes with the file you ownloaded.  Or, browse through the first page of posts.  Or, better yet, try searching for the error code ("0xc0000135") in the search box on the main page.

Nobody's asking you to reseach for an academic paper here, but the question has been asked repeatedly, and the answer's been given repeatedly.  I promise it takes all of 30 seconds to find the answer.

That's WTF.
Fixed the title of this issue.
Is there a way to detect whether they have the proper version installed?  If it can maybe it would be prudent to have it pop a "Idiot...go download .Net like the readme says" type message.
Nope. If they don't have .NET, not a single line of our code will run.
The only way around this would be by having an actual installer.

The zip file could contain a text warning, ie: after creating the zip file most zip programs will allow you to add popup text to be displayed when you open the file. This could contain a warning for users and perhaps prevent the brain dead and clueless issues like this appearing at least once a week.

Also the Known Issues section of the Issue Tracker could mention this (perhaps with a link to the Microsoft website?)
I haven't seen anything like that before, Levva... Link to info?
